column1: My mother had a sure foreboding at the second glance
column2: that it was Miss Betsey. The setting sun was glowing on the strange lady
column4: and she came walking up to the door with a fell rigidity of figure and composure of countenance that could have belonged to nobody else.When she reached the house
column5: she gave another proof of her identity. My father had often hinted that she seldom conducted herself like any ordinary Christian; and now
column7: she came and looked in at that identical window
column8: pressing the end of her nose against the glass to that extent
column9: that my poor dear mother used to say it became perfectly flat and white in a moment.She gave my mother such a turn
column10: that I have always been convinced I am indebted to Miss Betsey for having been born on a Friday.
